hl.seg: Tea: an Effective Cure for Breast Cancer

doc.seg: According to a new research, three cups of tea a day
if taken, can decrease the risk of cancer in women below 50 years of age by more than a third.
In research carried out by the Moffitt Cancer Institute, in the American state of Florida, it was revealed that the risk of occurrence of breast cancer tumors in women below the age of 50 years
who drink at least three cups of tea a day is reduced by up to 37%.
It was also revealed in the research that there was no significant benefit, in the woman over the age of 50, who drank three or more cups of tea a day.
Experts believe that the reason for this is that tea has ingredients in it, which are more effective against specific tumors which generally occur in women below the age of 50.
in the Moft Cancer Center situated in the State of Florida, research was carried out with 5,000 women, aged 20 to 70 years old, who had received treatment for breast cancer.
the experts compared their medical records and life patterns with that of women who were free from breast cancer.
the experts also found, that, in cases of Lobular cancer, tea had shown a great effect and it reduced by 66 percent.
almost 1/10th breast cancer patients suffers from this type.
This type of cancer is more dangerous because it originates deep inside the breast tissue, and is usually diagnosed when it has already spread to a great extent.
Experts state that, by drinking at least three cups of tea a day, the danger of breast cancer can be reduced in young women.
they further state that making tea a regular drink in daily life can cause great resistance in the body against breast cancer.
in Britain, every year, almost 40 thousand women are diagnosed with breast cancer.

New research.

Dr. Patricia P. Leka of Mayo Clinic, Minnesota says that increase in age is a big reason for health problems caused by exercise and less physical activity.
Dr. Patricia teaches medicine at Mayo clinic.
She headed a research trial regarding heart diseases and the ability to participate in exercise in older age.
Her team of doctors used high frequency sound waves to observe the performance of heart.
The heart's ability to pump blood along with its contraction and relaxation was studied.
Researchers focused their attention on the right side of the heart, which is the main part of the heart responsible for pumping blood through the body.
They came to know that as age increases, problems in the heart's relaxation ability also increase.
Dr. Patricia says as individuals age, problems occur in the relaxation of heart which affects the ability to exercise.
Dr. Garvin Ken was part of the research team.
He says that we were surprised to see age has an effect on the relaxation of the heart and it confirmed that bad exercising ability is very much related to the heart's relaxation ability.
Sometimes blood pressure can cause disorders in the heart's function as well as heart disease.
If closely monitored by their doctor, the patient can benefit from exercise regardless of age.
A detailed report concerning this matter is published in a magazine of American Medical Association.

Many of us who live in large towns and cities have grown used to working in noise which comes from several different sources. There is the noise of moving trains, which is heard at almost all hours of the day,

Already there is evidence that it does so in several ways. It has been recognized for a long time

More recently it has also been found that people who are continuously exposed to other loud noises require protection of the ear.
